Cognovit Clause.definition: a clause in an agreement in which one party authorizes the entry of judgment against himself or herself in the event of his or her breach or default
Cognovit Clause.origin: [New Latin cognovit ( actionem ) heshe has acknowledged (the action)]

1.1: a clause in an agreement in which one party authorizes the entry of judgment against himself or herself in the event of his or her breach or default
